question: theme
hint-mode
The first step in making decisions about starting a business is to define the problem/opportunity.
Carol can be considered an entrepreneur because she manages a coffee shop owned by her sister.
Insurance is not a risk associated with doing business in another country.
An income statement does not forecast how well the business can expect to perform in the future.
Inventory is an example of a current asset.
Fringe benefits are demonstrated when employees request employers to take out payments for health or dental insurance from their pay.
Payroll is the list of people who receive salary or wage payments from a business.
Every month, businesses must pay sales taxes to the federal government.
Giveaways of stationeries imprinted with the company name/logo is an example of self-promotion.
Weaknesses refer to negative external forces that inhibit the firm's ability to achieve its objectives.
The deed is a document used to evidence transfer of ownership of real property.
Potential is a part of the marketing mix.
Price is a part of the marketing mix.
The right to low prices is one of the Consumer Bill of Rights.
Philanthropy is the promotion of human welfare through giving.
The ____ follows the main body of a business plan.
hint: This section provides further details/visuals to support your ideas.

question: The ____ is the roadmap for a business.
____ are business possibilities that arise from existing conditions.
hint: This term is in the SWOT acronym.

question: ____ loans are backed by collateral.
The ____ is the grant of the exclusive right to make, use, import, sell, and offer a new product or process.
____ is an amount paid for a job position stated on an annual basis.
____ are managers who work directly with the employees who perform the day-to-day tasks of a business.
Establishing informal ties with people who can help your business grow is called ____.
____ is the act of establishing a favourable relationship with customers and the general public.
____ occurs when labour negotiations break down and a third party is brought to impose a settlement both sides must accept.
hint: This is a common method to settle disputes.

question: The express ____ gives an explicit assurance of quality of performance by the seller.
One major advantage of the ____ is that once the owner has paid all of the company's expenses, he/she can keep the remaining profits (less taxes).
hint: This two word term refers to the type of business with one owner.

question: CSR stands for corporate ____ responsibility.
hint: This is a type of regulation in regards to a company's community involvements.

question: When the employment relationship between a company and an employee is ended, it is known as a ____.
____ tasks refers to giving responsibilities to other employees, while remaining responsible for the results.
____ is the ability to learn a particular kind of job.
Prospective entrepreneurs should conduct a(n) ____ to determine their strengths and weaknesses.
Generally speaking, your marketing strategy will be determined mostly by your business's ____.
____ is not a strategy for dealing with global risk?
d: Conduct business only in one country

question: Co-ownership of property without the right of survivorship is ____.
____ covers the cost to repair an office building if it were damaged by fire.
The ____ is a financial statement that show how much money is available to pay bills.
Immediate transfer of ownership of goods from a seller to a buyer for a price is called a ____.
____ covers a company's legal responsibility for the harm it may cause to others as a result of what it and its employees do or fail to do in its business operations.
When a business allows another business to buy now and pay later, it is offering ____.
____ is a type of pricing technique that starts out with a low introductory price with the goal of building a strong customer base.
Employees fill out ____ forms for employers to determine the amount of taxes to deduct from pay checks.
____ is the practice of advertising a product at a low price while intentionally stocking only a limited number in hopes of luring shoppers to buy more expensive items.
The ____ believes that the right thing for a person to do in any situation is the action that best serves that person's own long-term interests.
____ permits a party to a contract to reover money or property given to the other party.
____ is made up of more than 10,500 retired executives who volunteer their time to provide entrepreneurs with real-world advice and know-how.
Lexi decides to open a flower shop. She is operating a ____ business.
Since the business purchases goods for resale, they are called the ____.
The ____ risk offers a chance to gain as well as lose from the event or activity.
Income earned by ____ is double taxed.
____ means to place the goods at the buyer's disposal.
Credit card fraud is an example of ____ risk.
A business can buy insurance to cover risks associated with ____.
Human actions have no effect on ____.
Once an entrepreneur has identified their goals, it is time to develop a marketing ____.
Product characteristics that will satisfy consumer needs are called ____.
Creating an image for a product in the customer's mind is called ____.
____ marketing consists of marketing activities designed to satisfy customer needs without negatively impacting the environment.
The ____ of ethics refers to social expectations of people's moral behaviour.
Payroll income taxes must be paid ____ by the employer.
